page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: This area includes the northern slopes of the{South Downs}The contor lines indicate steep, hilly land.The area has one wooded plantation of trees the remaining land being grassland.On the slopes can be found remnents of ancient settlements from the{Iron age. Most of the land is farmland. The area is used for grazing and culti- vation of crops. The{South Downs Way,} a public footpath traverses the area passing a{dew pond}and a{radio {station.}At the bottom of the slopes is a{chalk pit}and the villages of Beddingham and{Firle.}The village of Firle is part of an estate owned by {Lord Gage.}The main house is{Firle {Place }which is open to the public to view the art collection.The main{A27} road passes close to the villages and bus services connect them to the county town of{Lewes.}
